Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian pottery bowl; pale slip; glaze fired orange; frieze of alternating dot rosettes and sets of bars on top of rim; on floor, between broad bands, lotus and bud frieze; slightest remains of central motif; exterior: groups of dots around edge of rim; four narrow bands on wall.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 35, pl. 22, no. 1a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.177)
